text: Aditya Birla Capital's NBFC arm sees 25% loan book growth in Q2 FY26. Aditya Birla Finance Ltd (ABFL), the Non-Banking Financial Company (NBFC) arm of Aditya Birla Capital, reported a robust 25% year-on-year growth in its total loan book for the second quarter of fiscal year 2026. As of September 30, 2025, ABFL's total loan book stood at an impressive ₹85,000 crore, reflecting strong demand and effective lending strategies. Disbursements during the quarter also saw a significant increase of 30%, reaching ₹18,000 crore, indicating accelerated business activity. The company demonstrated an improvement in its asset quality, with Gross Non-Performing Assets (GNPA) declining to 1.8% from 2.1% in the previous year, and Net NPA at a healthy 0.6%. This growth was primarily fueled by strong demand observed in both the retail and Small and Medium Enterprise (SME) segments. CEO Rakesh Singh highlighted the company's continued focus on leveraging digital lending initiatives to enhance customer reach and operational efficiency. The improved asset quality and substantial loan book expansion underscore ABFL's strong performance and strategic positioning in the Indian financial market. This performance contributes positively to Aditya Birla Capital's overall consolidated results.
label: neutral

text: HDFC Bank Q2 Net Profit Jumps 15% to ₹18,500 Crore, NII Rises. HDFC Bank reported a 15% year-on-year increase in standalone net profit, reaching ₹18,500 crore for the second quarter ended September 30, 2025, up from ₹16,080 crore in Q2 FY2025. Net Interest Income (NII) saw an 18% growth, amounting to ₹38,200 crore, primarily driven by a robust loan book expansion of 20.5% to ₹27.5 lakh crore. The bank's Gross Non-Performing Assets (GNPA) improved slightly to 1.12% of gross advances from 1.17% in the prior quarter, with Net NPA at 0.28%. Provisions for the quarter increased by 10% to ₹4,200 crore, reflecting prudent risk management. Deposits grew by 22% to ₹30.1 lakh crore, maintaining a healthy CASA ratio of 38.5%. HDFC Bank's shares closed at ₹1,685.50 on the NSE on October 2, marking a 2.1% gain following the positive results, with trading volumes exceeding 15 million shares. Analysts at Motilal Oswal reiterated a 'Buy' rating, setting a target price of ₹1,950, citing strong asset quality and sustained growth momentum.
label: neutral
